--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Colin Green <cgreen@d...> wrote:

> Important Notice. There currently exists a problem in the genome 
> crossover code that allows multiple connections to accrue between 
two 
> neurons, or between a single neuron in the case of recurrent 
> conenctions. This will have some detrimental effect on searches, 
> although how much of an effect is not known. This problem is being 
> worked on.
> ------------------
> 
> Regarding the last point, I was intending to resolve this problem 
today 
> but I'm still deciding on the best way to do this. I was going to 
try 
> and maintain a full history of all additions, which would solve 
the 
> problem and actually it sounds like a better strategy. 
Unfortunately if 
> I do it this way then the problem re-appears when you distribute a 
> search over multiple PCs - or at least the using the way I was 
thinking 
> of doing distribution anyhow.

Why not just check during crossover whether any connection you are 
adding to the offspring genome is already there under a different 
number?  Crossover code has almost no effect on overall performance 
regardless of how much you optimize it.

ken
